Posts.Content: Hi everyone Due to start on Tamoxifen next week, any hints & tips for managing side effects? Heard Vit D for the joint pain? Also the Ladycare menopause magnet been recommended? Any suggestions just in case I get hot flushes, bone pain etc? I like to be prepared :-)
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: I haven't requested my prescription yet, the last time I saw my GP she just said phone up when you're ready to start on them. Are they one of the better brands that you're on? I hear of people constantly changing brands due to side effects! x
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Think I'll make an appointment with my GP next week before I start taking them! Thanks for the advice xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Hi Debs Thanks for the reply :-) Luckily I'm single so having a Tom in my life wouldn't be an issue! Lol! Did the doctors prescribe you Vit D and calcium or did you source it yourself? I work in a hotel so can work quite a few evenings and I want to try to avoid hot flushes etc at work if possible so I'll take mine just before bed. Was meant to start taking them this week but had full lymph node clearance last week to I've taken it upon myself to rebel and start a couple of weeks late as I'm dealing with enough at the moment xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: I haven't requested my prescription yet, the last time I saw my GP she just said phone up when you're ready to start on them. Are they one of the better brands that you're on? I hear of people constantly changing brands due to side effects! x

Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Just thought I would share a bit of good news for a change! After years of fighting to be tested for the brca1 and brca2 gene, and only being tested once I was diagnosed with breast cancer in August, I today got the results and I haven't got the gene!! Some good news for a change!! Still going through chemo at the moment, with rads and maybe full lymph node removal to follow once chemo is finished, but at least this is one less thing I have to worry about! I cried with happiness when I got the call. Â Now I'm off to try my wig on as most of my hair has fallen out today, but I'm still happy :-)
Posts.Title: Gene test result :-)

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone! Still a long way to go but makes a change having some good news for a change xx
Posts.Title: Gene test result :-)

Posts.Content: Thanks! I saw a doctor on Monday and spoke to another on Tuesday for a 2nd opinion and they said to just keep legs elevated. It goes down overnight then swells up again within an hour of getting up and only started Monday. I have my last chemo tomorrow so I'll check with them then. Haven't got any pains or breathlessness at the moment. I have just taken some steroids easy for chemo tomorrow x
Posts.Title: Swollen legs and feet??

Posts.Content: Will do. Doctor said to ask for full kidney function check when they do my bloods tomorrow. I've almost doubled in size since all this started, can't wait to take my last steroids on Friday and get back on Weight Watchers when I'm recovered! xx
Posts.Title: Swollen legs and feet??

Posts.Content: Spoke to 2 GP's but I don't trust anyone these days so can't wait to see oncologist tomorrow, will be first thing I mention when I get there! There is no redness or pain, and it does go down when I elevate my feet but I always fear the worst, as do most people! And strange that it's only just started when I'm in my last session. I'll be awake worrying all night, but just taken my first lot of steroids today so I probably won't sleep anyway! Oh the joys of chemo! Thanks for your replies xxx
Posts.Title: Swollen legs and feet??

Posts.Content: Hi Are swollen legs and feet a side effect from chemo? I've had 5 sessions, with my last one being this Thur, but my legs and feet ballooned yesterday. I had a doctors appointment for something else and showed him but he didn't seem concerned and asked me just to elevate my legs when I got home, this seemed to work but they have gone the same again today when I have come back into work. Any ideas? x
Posts.Title: Swollen legs and feet??

Posts.Content: Update on my swollen legs and feet. Oncologist wasn't worried as it had vanished by the time I saw him. However, it happened again yesterday so I'm beginning to think its when I drink alcohol. I was drinking the Friday & Saturday both times it's happened, and the swelling started on the Sunday's. Has anyone else experienced this, if so will it calm down eventually as my chemo finished on the 23rd Feb? x
Posts.Title: Swollen legs and feet??

Posts.Content: HI It's called Relon. Having a few hot flushes but only small ones which aren't a problem, but the aching bones is hard work. If I changed to another brand I'm worried that the hot flushes would be worse, and I have only been on it 3 weeks xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & bone aches

Posts.Content: Good afternoon all :-) I started on Tamoxifen 3 weeks ago and my bones are aching like crazy! I have to roll out of bed, and hold on to the bannister when walking down the stairs. I'm assuming that this is one of many lovely side effects! Aside from painkillers, which I don't want to take, any ideas how to ease this or will it ease in time? Or get worse? :-(
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & bone aches

Posts.Content: Thanks Val, same to you!! I pray for rain everyday, having my hair growing back, wearing a wig, and hot flushes - it's torture!! Mix all that with alcohol and I'm a big, sweaty mess! Lol! But I don't let it ruin my life, went out Saturday night until 4am Sunday morning, even got a cheeky snog :-) I suffered for it all day yesterday though, but who cares!! It is weird when you finish all your treatment, no more appointments, don't know what to do with yourself! Anyway good luck tomorrow, I cried all day with my last radiotherapy, so emotional knowing it's all over! Apart from the Tamoxifen xxxx
Posts.Title: Treatment finished :-)

Posts.Content: Thanks!! Off work today so I'm on an ordering and buying mission :-)
Posts.Title: Preparing for chemo

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies, I'm writing all of this down. A chemo box sounds like a great idea, I already have a little stash of items xx
Posts.Title: Preparing for chemo

Posts.Content: Hi I start chemo on the 11th Nov and I'm trying to be prepared by buying little things now that may help with the symptoms. Everytime I read a thread on here I pick up ideas and make a list. Not sure if that sounds silly or not but I don't want to be messing around if I'm ill. Bought some children's toothpaste and a children's toothbrush, a thermometer and some salt to rinse my mouth out with to prevent ulcers. Does this sound silly, it does when I write it! Lol! Anyone recommend anything else? Louise xx
Posts.Title: Preparing for chemo

Posts.Content: Just had my last radiotherapy!! My treatment is over! Well apart from 5 years of Tamoxifen and a lifetime of massaging my arm! 296 days since diagnosis, lumpectomy, 5 nodes removed, chemotherapy, full node clearance then radiotherapy - and it's all over!! Not sure how I feel, it's weird! No more appointments, no one mauling me until my next mammogram, no more pills and injections! Just been on a spending spree courtesy of Mr MasterCard, I'll worry about how to pay it off later! Lol! And booked a short break in Poland, the same break I had to cancel when I got diagnosed. Big sunshine holiday next year once my hair has grown back and I can lose the wig :-) Been through a lot but it wasn't half as bad as I was expecting, especially the chemo. So for any of you recently diagnosed, hang on in there, it's doable and time flies by! And good luck to all xxx
Posts.Title: Treatment finished :-)

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone!! My nipple is like a pontefract cake after the radiotherapy but it's all good :-) Nefertiti I started Tamoxifen a few weeks before my radiotherapy, I don't think it made any difference to be honest. Radiotherapy was a breeze, just very tiring and the skin under my boob where my bra seam is went tender and started peeling but they gave me some fab spongy dressings to put under so my bra didn't rub. Just remember to moisturise the area 3 times a day. I had to get some cream for my nipple as it was itchy as hell, and as every woman knows it's not easy to scratch your nipple! Lol xx
Posts.Title: Treatment finished :-)

Posts.Content: Morning Val! How did your last treatment go??? xx
Posts.Title: Treatment finished :-)
